meanings.definition: Assertive of authority in an annoyingly domineering way.
meanings.sent1: The officious manager constantly interfered with everyone's work.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her officious behavior, always telling others what to do.
meanings.sent3: The officious neighbor kept rearranging the garden gnome without permission.
meanings.sent4: His officious attitude made him the self-proclaimed leader of the group.
meanings.sent5: The officious security guard insisted on checking everyone's bags multiple times.

meanings.definition: Intrusively enthusiastic in offering help or advice.
meanings.sent1: The officious salesperson followed me around the store, recommending products.
meanings.sent2: She was so officious, always trying to fix things that weren't broken.
meanings.sent3: The officious waiter kept suggesting dishes that were not on the menu.
meanings.sent4: Her officious nature made her the go-to person for event planning.
meanings.sent5: The officious volunteer eagerly took charge of the charity event.

meanings.definition: Volunteering one's services where they are neither asked nor needed.
meanings.sent1: The officious at the community center was always offering to help, even when not required.
meanings.sent2: He became known as the officious of the office, always stepping in to assist.
meanings.sent3: The officious at the animal shelter would show up unannounced to volunteer.
meanings.sent4: She was the officious of the school, always ready to lend a hand.
meanings.sent5: The officious in the park would pick up litter without being asked.
